wikipedia_page.main: Sir William Ray (7 February 1876 – 30 September 1937) was a Conservative politician in the United Kingdom. He was knighted in 1928. Ray was elected Member of Parliament (MP) for Richmond in 1932, resigning in 1937.

response: The Richmond-upon-Thames by-election of 1937 was held on 25 February 1937.  The by-election was held due to the resignation of the incumbent Conservative MP, William Ray.  It was won by the Conservative candidate George Harvie-Watt.

The Richmond-upon-Thames by-election of 1932 was held on 13 April 1932.  The by-election was held due to the resignation of the incumbent Conservative MP, Newton Moore.  It was won by the Conservative candidate William Ray.
